column5: I'll try to put up more of a report later, but here's what I encountered at my preferred boat launch this weekend. It's almost June Mother Nature! Helloooo???
beauty scenery - but yeah, it is definitley one confused spring this year, aint it?
Man,  I haven't seen any of that stuff for over a month here. I would not have been happy.
Mother Nature is just protecting her brook trout .....lol
We had wet snow here a couple days ago Dan but nuthin like you've got up your way....thankfully
It's been far too long since I stood in that spot and enjoyed the view Dan.  Maybe this year.
I think you and I have a different sense of humour Dan.

At least you had winter we have not had enough safe ice on the Thames river to get out in three seasons. My daughter is not impressed I would like to get out but 2-3" of uneven ice is not good for me.
Yes, she's a fickle bit............  Nevermind, I feel your pain!
No dock I bet as well eh Dan? LOL!!!!   That's insane!   Let's hope it warms up for August  :)  Did you end up checking out the launch at Pine Portage?

Launched at Portage Bill. Put over 40 miles on the boat without a sniff all day. We were dodging icebergs all day and never found water warmer than 36f. Had some fun in the lower river sections though. I walked into a place where a creek enters the system and caught 6 Specks in half an hour from shore. They're in there after the smelts, which are still spawning up here. And we got some Steel and a few more Brookies in the lower section. Not the best weekend, but still had some fun and found a few fish.
Poor guy.  Six plus specks and some steel.  That does make a cool pic Dan.  Too bad it didn't go quite as planned but I bet you enjoyed the w/e nonetheless.
Great shot Dan! That's the stuff of a beer commercial.
Yikes!!!  That's just brutal!  Glad you found a place to launch though.  Looking forward to your report...always love the pictures you take!!
Wow , yes mother nature has been a fickle lady this year !

That would drive me crazy at this time of the year.  I was upset when we launched the first weekend in April and saw a skim of ice at the launch.  At least you got out and found a few fish, can't ask for much more than that given the conditions. Hope that ice is gone soon for ya Dan.

Blah Blah Blah ... whine whine whine .(or should I say wine wine wine)... where's the speck pics ... my monster this weekend was 1lb 12 oz .... probably BAIT for your coasters   Still waiting for my invite btw
